author: Wilbur Twilliger
comment: I bought this for my note 4 a few years ago, and it worked, but it seemed to crash every so often, though when it worked, it worked well.  I now have it on my Note 8, and haven't seen any trouble with it at all, it works very well, finding and doing whatever I ask it to. I want to show this off to friends/family this holiday season, I'm pretty sure they will be impressed. I've gotten 2 others into Plex, perhaps they will like this as well!

author: Gareth Lewis-Pitt
comment: Would live for this to work but it just responds, "Sorry, I didn't understand that" to everything I say.

author: Dare Behr
comment: Won't recognize my Plex server, linked fine but unusable. And what's with the Trialware? Uninstalled.

author: John Briggs
comment: Need to be able to choose a lower quality setting for Chromecast than 1.5mbps

author: J Moye
comment: Everything works fine, except it crashes constantly. I generally cannot keep the app open for more than one full minute.

author: John McClenahan
comment: The voice recognition works fine,  but it never finds anything I ask to watch or play
Doesn't seem to want to connect with my server that requires SSL connection.
Works well using android phone to fire tv. Does what it says.

author: Eric Martin
comment: Bought the chromecast option and can't see my audio device. Useless then. Also it doesn't recognise my voice. How can I get my money back?

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Please email me if you'd like help, as Chromecast does work for others. If it's not understanding your voice, I'm not sure what I can do, since it's using Google's voice recognition. But email me and I'll do what I can.

title: Doesn't work

author: chris tschinkel
comment: Great job! I contributed to the development fund. Any chance of creating something like this as an Alexa skill?
title: Great job!

author: caf33n hed8k
comment: I would buy the wear support if it wasn't so buggy, couldn't get it to work once without crashing on galaxy S7 and plex for smart tv, sent an error report just in case the Dev is still alive.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: I'm sorry you're having trouble. I never got an error report from you, though. My email is atomjack at gmail, is that where you sent it?

title: Unstable

author: Paul Killeen
comment: I can't seem to get the pause/resume commands to work? I keep getting an error?

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: If you could email me I can try to help you get it working.

title: Great....

author: Barry McKinlay
comment: I have a Plex Home Theater server on a Linux NAS and even though I'm signed into my account, this app doesn't see or play anything on the remote client. I wasn't looking for local (on phone) control. I can just touch the screen to control Plex. Uninstalled.
title: Installed ok, didn't work for me though

author: kurt spieldenner
comment: Google needs to label 'trialware' as such. Waste of my time. In app purchases, no thank you!
title: Trialware, one minute only

author: Dan Powers
comment: Seems ok at searching, but it won't see any of my Chromecast Audio devices; only the video devices.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Can you drop me an email? Chromecast Audio should work. I don't have one myself but I have had other users report that it does work.

title: Chromecast Audio support?

author: Korey Edwards
comment: It finds my plex server and available devices to cast to but can't find any media that I pass. The toast appears with the proper show/movie but fails to find it. Play back commands also causes the app to crash.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Could you use the email device logs feature and send me your logs? I can then figure out why you're not finding any media and fix any problems.

title: Almost works

author: Chris skaggs
comment: Throws an error when trying to play on my Fire TV, which uses the Android Plex app. But it ends up playing just fine. Can't believe I didn't find this sooner.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Thanks Chris! If you wanna email me I can try to figure out why the error is being thrown and fix it.

title: Works great!

author: Lee West
comment: Top drawer program. All it's missing is the ability to use the volume rocker to adjust Plex volume and shut down, sleep, quit commands and it'd be perfect.
title: Magic

author: Andy Green
comment: Super simple.  Press button. Say play blah blah blah. Nice one dev!
title: Works great

author: Dean Wallace
comment: After a few kinks the dev worked out with me, it's working great.. Impressed it doesn't need the phone screen on either... (Dev is a legend for support, give him a chance before bad rating him)

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Thanks Dean!

author: Ian Urquhart
comment: Title says it all. App works exactly as advertised and this + tasker is just fantastic. The Dev is super responsive and has created an excellent app. If you use Plex you owe it to yourself to get this app

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Thanks!

title: Fantastic

author: Ron digraz
comment: Black screen

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Sorry about that, I recently reconfigured some stuff and ended up breaking something. It should work now, although you may have to factory reset your Chromecast first.

author: Kelly Correia
comment: Took a bit to get connected to the server but after that, this app was fast and worked perfect. Very happy!

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Sweet!!

author: Em Ka
comment: it's great. but i really miss playlist and multiple player support (android together with PHT)..
title: great

author: Loquacious One
comment: What good is voice control if it can't find anything?  Serious disappointment with this app, didn't want to work with Plex through Roku 3 for me. Please don't try to offer help, am not buying a bunch of add on apps to make this happen, the experiment is over for me, but am happy for those who got it to work for them and are pleased to use it. I'll stick to using my Logitech Harmony remote, it finds everything. Uninstalled.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content:
I'm sorry you had problems. You won't need to buy any addons for the app to work with a Roku - the addons are just for Chromecast and Android Wear support. 

If you change your mind and reach out to me, I'll be happy to help you get it working.

title: Can't find anything?

author: josh farrell
comment: Love this app. Great hands free access to my music via plex while driving.  Thank you for everything :-)
title: Awesome app and Developer

author: tony pordon
comment: awesome app and really amazing communication from a dev that actually wants to work with his users!
title: nice!

author: Peter flaherty
comment: This app is really great, thanks Dev. Would love to see wear support. Plus anyway around not having to root to integrate it into google now (probably not possible). Keep it up! Thanks a lot for developing this. Much cheaper than an xbox1 EDIT: Totally works in google now with tasker & auto voice unrooted!

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: I added Wear Support in Version 2.0. Check it out :)

title: Really great

author: Matthew Flippen
comment: Null value error for all shows I tried.  Not working with chromecast on 3 different devices.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Could you email me? I'd be happy to help you get it working.

title: Doesn't work

author: Lee Banner
comment: Doesn't connect to client

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Can you please email me? I'd be happy to help you get it working properly.

author: Patrick Kettner
comment: As far as controlling plex with your voice...it works great!  It would be great to be able to play an entire season of a show, rather than just a single episode.   The UI for chromecast is less than beautiful, and it lacks volume control like the offical plex app does on chromecast.

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. I'll look into adding volume control for Chromecast playback, and possibly playing an entire season of a show. If you have any other suggestions or would like to elaborate further on these please post to my XDA thread.

title: Works well, could improve

author: Albert Barajas
comment: This app is pretty good just need some improvements I wish I could customize my own commands for example I would like to listen to random music or random music from 1 artist maybe I'm just a newbie

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Those are great suggestions, I'll look into them soon. If you have any other suggestions or would like to elaborate further on these, please post to my XDA thread.

title: Good app needs improvements

author: Zaid Alharbash
comment: Initially only played TV shows, but after contacting the developer I was able to get it running as advertised. Great app. High recommended!

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Thanks!

title: Works like a charm after update

author: sean hatley
comment: Crashes and doesn't play my files just a spinning circle... Disappointed

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Could you email me? I know it works very well for others, so I'd be happy to help you get it working.

author: Grant Wilson
comment: Works perfectly!

author: Bret Campbell
comment: But I haven't been able to get it to work. App freezes when I try to install the home screen shortcut (while choosing the player-a roku 3). I'm not sure it's worth the novelty to pay for and install Tasker. Thanks though!

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Can you email me? I'd be happy to help you get it working.

title: Cool idea

author: Steve Murphy
comment: Doesn't recognise anything you say. No sign of any control of the client

reply.author: Chris Bellew
reply.content: Would you mind posting to the XDA thread or else emailing me for help? I'd be happy to help you get it working.

title: Not even close to functional

author: Eric smith
comment: Well designed and works well. Amazing this is actually free.  Great job!
title: Amazing App!!!

author: Craig Trunzo
comment: Makes automating Plex a breeze. So simple to setup and use.
title: Great companion app to Plex

author: nadeem ali
comment: Bus acha he
